'''Kim Thomson''' (born 1960"Kim Thomson." ''Contemporary Theatre, Film and Television''. Vol. 76. Gale, 2007, pages 333-335.) is an English actress who has appeared on stage, television and film since the early 1980s in both the United Kingdom and the United States. ==Early life== Thomson had a Scottish father and an Irish mother. Her parents split up when she was three and she was brought up in [[Surrey]] by her father's parents, who were originally from [[Alloa]].{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=Kim Thomson |url=http://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/202499/Kim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closetKim-Thomson-In-the-closet#ixzz1IR1mhE5r |quote=Kim Thomson, 50, plays Faye Lamb in ITV1âs Emmerdale. She has appeared in many high-profile TV dramas, including Inspector Morse, Midsomer Murders and Trial and Retribution. Currently single, she recently graduated from the University of London with a degree in politics, philosophy and history. She divides her time between London, Leeds and Los Angeles. |newspaper=[[Daily Express]] |date=September 29, 2010 |accessdate=2011-04-03 }}{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/showbiz/television-news/2009/10/18/i-m-delighted-i-swapped-hollywood-for-emmerdale-says-kim-thomson-78057-21756426/ |quote=She said: "I'm Celtic. My father was Scottish, my mother Irish. I was brought up by my dad's parents who have sadly died but were Scots. My family are from Alloa. I love Scotland. I sound so English but I actually didn't realise that until I was older.|title=I'm delighted I swapped Hollywood for Emmerdale, says Kim Thomson |publisher=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|The Daily Record]] |author=Steve Hendry |date=18 October 2009 |accessdate=14 November 2010}} At the age of six, she was sent to a boarding school for five years. Much later she went on record to say boarding schools should be abolished.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-interviews/2010/03/01/emmerdale-star-kim-thomson-i-ve-handed-out-a-few-slaps-since-i-joined-soap-and-received-a-few-86908-22077627/ |title=Emmerdale star Kim Thomson: I've handed out a few slaps since I joined soap.. and received a few |publisher=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|The Daily Record]] |author=Rick Fulton |date=1 March 2010 |accessdate=14 November 2010}} She trained as an actress at the [[Central School of Speech and Drama]]. ==Career== Thomson shared her first lead in ''[[Stealing Heaven]]'' (1988) with [[Derek de Lint]] and [[Denholm Elliot]]. In its review, ''Films and filming'' said "Kim Thomson's [[HÃ©loÃ¯se dâArgenteuil|HeloÃ¯se]] moves with delicate poise, a heroine worthy of [[Dante Gabriel Rossetti|Rossetti]] or [[Edward Burne-Jones|Burne-Jones]], with vivacity and intelligence.''Films and filming'', Issues 413-422 (Hansom Books, 1989), pp. 44-45 The next year, 1989, she played [[Estella Havisham|Estella]] in a film of ''[[Great Expectations (1989 film)|Great Expectations]]'' directed by [[Kevin Connor (director)|Kevin Connor]], with [[Jean Simmons]], who had played Estella in the [[Great Expectations (1946 film)|1946 film]], as [[Miss Havisham]].John Glavin, ''Dickens on Screen'', p. 214 Also in 1989 she was [[Cordelia (King Lear)|Cordelia]] on stage in ''[[King Lear]]'', directed by [[Jonathan Miller]], with the ''British Theatre Yearbook'' commenting "Kim Thomson's Cordelia can rarely have been equalled; she was exquisite in beauty, tender in care, full of youthful integrity."David Lemmon, ''British Theatre Yearbook 1990'', pp. 43-44 In 1992, Thomson was the [[leading lady]] of the TV series ''[[Virtual Murder]]'', and in 1994 played another leading role in a [[costume drama]] series, ''[[The Wanderer (1994 TV series)|The Wanderer]]''. Dozens more appearances in film and on television followed, often as a [[character actor]], such as her role as a society reporter in ''[[The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement]]'' (2004). In 1997, she took on the part of Lady Chiltern in ''[[An Ideal Husband]]'', of which the ''Theatre Record'' said "Others have played this pure, cool, idealistic, demanding role with more authority and finesse, but she is simply right for it".''Theatre Record'', vol. 17, Issues 9-17 (1997), p. 975 In 2001, she was Irina in a new [[West End theatre]] production of ''[[Uncle Vanya]]'' directed by [[Peter Gill (playwright)|Peter Gill]].Plays international, vol. 17 (Chancery Publications Ltd., 2001), p. 9 During 2008 Thomson had a recurring role in ITV's detective show ''[[The Bill]]'', as [[barrister]] Naomi Woods, wife of DC Jacob Banks. In March 2009, she became a regular cast member of the ITV1 soap opera ''[[Emmerdale]]'', playing the role of [[Faye Lamb]]. At the end of 2009, she signed a new contract with the show. In January 2011, it was reported that she was leaving the show and would make her on-screen departure later in the year.Daniel Kilkelly, ''[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a301055/kim-thomson-to-leave-emmerdale.html Kim Thomson to leave 'Emmerdale']'', dated 30 January 2011, at digitalspy.co.uk, accessed 3 April 2011 ==Personal life== Thomson studied at the [[University of London]] as a mature student for a degree in politics, philosophy and history, and graduated in the summer of 2010. She canvassed for [[Barack Obama]] in Nevada during the [[United States presidential election, 2008|presidential election of 2008]] and also supported [[Gordon Brown]].
